benchmark_details.name: Ko-PIQA (Korean Physical Commonsense Reasoning Dataset with Cultural Context)
benchmark_details.overview: Ko-PIQA is a Korean physical commonsense reasoning dataset that incorporates cultural context, featuring 441 high-quality PIQA-style questions, with 19.7% containing culturally specific elements.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To serve as a benchmark for evaluating Korean language models in physical commonsense reasoning and promote culturally aware AI systems.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset contains only 441 questions, which is smaller than existing benchmarks, potentially limiting its utility for model fine-tuning.

data.source: 3.01 million web-crawled Korean questions from Naver Knowledge iN
data.annotation: Human validated by native Korean speakers

methodology.calculation: Exact match accuracy, where a response is correct only if it exactly matches the ground truth label.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy levels are reported across all questions and broken down by cultural specificity.
methodology.baseline_results: Best model achieved 83.22% accuracy, weakest at 59.86%.
methodology.validation: Human validation and deduplication were performed before finalizing the dataset.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes cultural specificity which may impact evaluation and performance.
